1.title: United Nations SECURITY COUNCIL
1.content:
LETTER DATED 22 JULY 1949 FROM THE DIRECTOR-GENERAL FOREIGN AFFAIRS, KATHMANDU, NEPAL TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMMITTEE ON THE ADMISSION OF NEW MEMBERS

Kathmandu, 22 July 1949

I have the honour to inform you that Major Padma Bahadur Khatri, the representative of the Kingdom of Nepal in New York, has forwarded to me your letter dated 26 May 1949...

1.title: REPLY TO INQUIRY OF UNITED NATIONS COMMITTEE ON THE ADMISSION OF NEW MEMBERS
1.content: The Government of Nepal forwards this reply to the letter of the Chairman of the Committee of 26 May 1949...

1.title: Information Supplied by the Government of Nepal Regarding Sovereignty and Independence
1.content: 1. Nepal has for centuries been an independent sovereign State...

1.title: Treaty of 1923 – Article I Interpretation
1.content: The existing situation does not confer, nor does it claim to confer, independence on Nepal for the first time...

1.title: Re: Afghan Treaty (Additional Clarifications)
1.content: With regard to both Article V and Article VI of this Treaty, the Government of Nepal has observed that similar provisions appear in the Treaty signed on 22 November 1921...

1.title: Territorial Cessions and Later Restorations
1.content: (ii) That the cession of a portion of these territories—namely, the greater part of those secondly and thirdly mentioned in the article—was renounced by the British Government on 8 December 1816...
